page.title: 07AMENITIES
page.content: There are no shops in Whatton or Scarrington. But in Aslockton there is a local shop called Spinks Bakery. It sells freshly baked bread and all the food we may need. Mainly Spinks shop is used when people run out of something so they can rush there and buy it quickly. Most people shop in Nottingham or Bingham. The Post Office sells groceries and sweets aswell as pensions and stamps. We also have a butchers in the village called Pailings which sells all the meat you can think of. Our Paper Shop just sells newspapers and magazines.Just by the railway crossing there is a petrol station which sells petrol and tyres. As we said that there are no shops in Whatton there is however a garage which sells spare parts for cars and conducts some repairs.
